Node.definition: literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= process of conception, described as going out from one's father's seed
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= causative action by which humans or deities cause information that is stored in someone else's mind to be reprocessed by speaking about it
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be encouraged|to rely on|to depend on
Node.definition: = process by which humans receive mental strength as a result of the help provided by others
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= referent pointing to a period or point of time in the distant past
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: (word) come out of (someone); hence: = process by which words are spoken by humans or deities

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: hard; hence: = state in which humans are stubborn and unwilling to yield
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= a piece of tough fibrous connecting tissue uniting muscles to bones ► and so forming the inner framework of the body
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= front part of the head; ≈ associated with stubbornness and lack of shame
= a yellowish brown alloy of copper with up to one third tin, ≈ regarded as a hard and difficult to bend
= referent pointing to a period or point of time in the distant past
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold; ► functions as an object of non sanctioned worship
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: looked for or guarded; hence: = state in which certain information is not generally known and difficult to access
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

Node.gloss: to create (an event)|to cause to happen
Node.definition: = causative action by which a deity causes something to happen that did not happen before
= referent pointing to a period or point of time in the distant past

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent pointing to a period or point of time in the distant past
literally: to open (someone's) ear; hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to hear
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded

Node.gloss: to be slow to anger|to be patient
Node.definition: literally: to prolong (= delay) one's anger; hence: = to be not given to anger
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= action by which a deity keep his anger in check or under control and refrains from intervening
= particle marking a proposition as not true
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death

= causative action by which deities improve the character of humans by leading them through difficult circumstances, ◄ like a goldsmith improves the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire and so removing all contaminants
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events|= action by which someone evaluates the dependability and/or reliability of someone else ◄ as an assayer examines ore or metal

= a construction ◄ made of hardened clay or of bricks ► and used for the smelting of ore or the firing of ceramic ware; ≈ often used figuratively to denote a prolonged period of hardship; also associated with times of testing and trial
literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= causative action by which humans or deities bring dishonor on other humans
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to found; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities bring something into existence

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= causative action by which deities extend a flat object over a certain space
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= action by which humans complete a task with the expected or desired outcome
literally: road; hence: = a journey made for a specific purpose, usually on someone else’s behalf

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening
= state in which knowledge, an object, or an action is kept hidden or unknown from others

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= causative action by which humans or deities give instructions to (other) humans with respect to a certain aspect of life, ◄ as if they take them by the hand and lead them along the way
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion|literally: offspring of bowels
= small, hard particle ◄ of sand (חֹול)
literally: to cut off (an event); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to stop happening

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
literally: to bring out; hence: = causative process by which certain information is made publicly known
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire
= a place where no one can live, whether as a result of destruction or not
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation

Node.gloss: to split|to cleave|to rip open|to cut|to rend|to maul|to divide|to break through
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or human cause an object to split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence
= hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security
= process whereb liquids move freely as in a stream

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
